page.title: 07WASHTON VILLAGE
page.content: Washton village is a very peaceful place. The only road through the village is a dead end. The houses are a mixture of styles; most are old such as Keld Cottage where the windows were blocked up in the 18th century to avoid paying tax. There is not much to do in the village apart from drinking in the pub or playing quoits on the village green. The green was used as the site for village celebrations such as May Day and local fetes. In 1982 Washton won an award as the best kept village in the area. There are about 20 dwellings in Washton two of them are farms.
